meanings.definition: To build something outside of a main building.
meanings.sent1: The family decided to outbuild a small shed in the backyard for extra storage.
meanings.sent2: The construction company was hired to outbuild a new garage next to the house.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outbuild the neighbor's treehouse, Tim built a mini castle in his yard.
meanings.sent4: With determination and hard work, the team managed to outbuild their previous record in constructing a playground.
meanings.sent5: The children used their toy blocks to outbuild each other in a friendly competition.

meanings.definition: To surpass in building or construction.
meanings.sent1: The skilled architect was able to outbuild all others in designing innovative structures.
meanings.sent2: Despite the challenges, the team managed to outbuild the deadline and complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising turn of events, the rookie builder was able to outbuild the experienced contractors in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The ancient civilization's ability to outbuild massive monuments still astonishes historians today.
meanings.sent5: The determined inventor sought to outbuild all previous inventions with his groundbreaking design.
